ASD.text: Does your child have difficulty making eye contact during conversations?
Does your child struggle to understand other people's feelings or emotions?
Does your child prefer to play alone rather than with other children?
Does your child have difficulty starting or maintaining conversations?
Does your child repeat words or phrases over and over (echolalia)?
Does your child take things literally and have trouble understanding sarcasm or jokes?
Does your child have very specific routines and get upset when they change?
Does your child have intense interests in specific topics or objects?
Does your child engage in repetitive movements (hand flapping, rocking, spinning)?
Is your child overly sensitive to sounds, lights, textures, or smells?
Does your child have unusual reactions to the way things look, smell, taste, feel, or sound?
Does your child line up toys or objects in a specific way?
Does your child have difficulty adapting to new situations or environments?
Does your child avoid physical contact or hugs?
Does your child have difficulty understanding non-verbal cues like facial expressions or body language?
Does your child have trouble sharing interests or achievements with others?
Does your child use unusual hand or finger movements near their face?
Does your child have delayed speech or language development?
Does your child have difficulty playing pretend or imaginative games?
Does your child become extremely distressed by minor changes in routine?

ADHD.text: Does your child have difficulty paying attention to details or make careless mistakes?
Does your child have trouble sustaining attention in tasks or play activities?
Does your child seem not to listen when spoken to directly?
Does your child fail to follow through on instructions and fail to finish tasks?
Does your child have difficulty organizing tasks and activities?
Does your child avoid or dislike tasks requiring sustained mental effort?
Does your child lose things necessary for tasks and activities?
Is your child easily distracted by external stimuli?
Is your child forgetful in daily activities?
Does your child fidget with hands or feet or squirm in seat?
Does your child leave seat in situations when remaining seated is expected?
Does your child run or climb excessively in inappropriate situations?
Does your child have difficulty playing quietly?
Is your child always 'on the go' or acts as if 'driven by a motor'?
Does your child talk excessively?
Does your child blurt out answers before questions are completed?
Does your child have difficulty waiting their turn?
Does your child interrupt or intrude on others?
Does your child act without thinking about consequences?
Does your child have difficulty controlling impulses?
Does your child have trouble completing homework or chores?
Does your child start tasks but quickly lose focus?
Does your child have difficulty following multi-step instructions?
Does your child seem restless, even when trying to relax?
Does your child have difficulty managing time and meeting deadlines?

Dyslexia.text: Does your child have difficulty recognizing letters or learning the alphabet?
Does your child struggle with matching letters to sounds?
Does your child have trouble reading single words in isolation?
Does your child read slowly and with great difficulty?
Does your child avoid reading activities?
Does your child have difficulty sounding out unfamiliar words?
Does your child confuse similar-looking letters (b/d, p/q)?
Does your child have trouble remembering sequences (days of the week, alphabet)?
Does your child struggle with spelling, even common words?
Does your child have difficulty writing, including letter formation?
Does your child reverse or transpose letters when writing?
Does your child have trouble expressing thoughts in writing?
Does your child have difficulty rhyming words?
Does your child struggle to segment words into individual sounds?
Does your child have difficulty blending sounds to make words?
Does your child mispronounce long or unfamiliar words?
Does your child have trouble learning foreign languages?
Does your child take much longer than peers to complete reading or writing tasks?
Does your child have difficulty following written instructions?
Does your child have trouble understanding what they've just read?
Does your child confuse the order of letters in words?
Does your child have difficulty copying from the board or book?
Does your child have trouble remembering what they've read?
Does your child have difficulty learning multiplication tables or math facts?
Does your child show frustration or anxiety about reading activities?
